function firstLetterOf(arr, index) { return arr[index][0].toUpperCase() } function abbrevName(name){ const arr = name.split(' ‘) return ${firstLetterOf(arr, 0)}.${firstLetterOf(arr, 1)} }
def abbrev_name(name): arr = name.split() return arr[0][0].upper()+'.'+arr[1][0].upper()
package kata func Maps(x []int) (res []int) { for _, v := range x { res = append(res, v*2) } return }
function maps(x){ return x.map(x=>x*2) }
def maps(a): return list(map(lambda x: x*2, a)) def maps2(a): res = [] for v in a: res.append(v*2) return res

// invalid indirect of 2 (type untyped number) // goì—ì„œëŠ” ** ì—°ì‚°ìê°€ ì œê³±ì´ ì•„ë‹ˆë‹¤. í¬ì¸í„°ê°€ ê°€ë¦¬í‚¤ëŠ” ë©”ëª¨ë¦¬ì˜ ê°’ì„ ê°€ì ¸ì˜¤ëŠ” ë“¯ func Past(h, m, s int) int { return (h*60**2+m*60+s)*1000 } package kata func Past(h, m, s int) int { return (h6060+m*60+s)*1000 }
def past(h, m, s): return (h60**2+m60+s)*1000
package kata func BoolToWord(word bool) string { if word { return “Yes” } return “No” }
function boolToWord( bool ){ return bool ? “Yes” : “No” }
def bool_to_word1(boolean): return “Yes” if boolean else “No” def bool_to_word2(boolean): if boolean: return “Yes” return “No”
function isDivisible(n, x, y) { return n%x+n%y===0 }
def is_divisible(n,x,y): return n%x==0 and n%y==0

function multiTable(number) { let res = ‘'; for ( let i = 1; i < 11; i++ ){ if ( i === 10) { res += ${i} * ${number} = ${i*number} } else { res += ${i} * ${number} = ${i*number}+'\n’ }; }; return res } function multiTable(number) { let res = ‘'; for ( let i = 1; i < 11; i++ ){ res += ${i} * ${number} = ${i*number}+(i<10 ?

(ns multiply.bug.fix) ;; My solution (defn multiply [a b] (* a b)) ;; Best practice (def multiply *) ( comment ë°°ìš´ ê²ƒ 1. í´ë¦°ì½”ë“œë¥¼ ì“´ ì—‰í´ë°¥ì€ ìµœí›„ì˜ í”„ë¡œê·¸ë˜ë° ì–¸ì–´ê°€ ìˆë‹¤ë©´ í´ë¡œì €ì¼ ê²ƒì´ë¼ê³ ë§í–ˆë‹¤ê³ í•œë‹¤. 2. í´ë¡œì €ëŠ” statementê°€ ì—†ë‹¤. ëª¨ë‘ expression. expressionì„ í¬í•¨í•˜ëŠ” ê²ƒì´ statement. ì •í™•í•˜ê²Œ ì°¨ì´ë¥¼ ì •ë¦¬í•´ì„œ ì´í•´í• ê²ƒ 3. nsëŠ” ë„¤ì„ìŠ¤í˜ì´ìŠ¤, defëŠ” ì •ì˜ë¬¸, defnì€ def + fn í•¨ìˆ˜ë¥¼ ì •ì˜ )
const quarterOf = (month) => { return Math.ceil(month/3) }

/* Given two integer arrays a, b, both of length >= 1, create a program that returns true if the sum of the squares of each element in a is strictly greater than the sum of the cubes of each element in b. */ // ë‹¤ë¥¸ ì‚¬ëŒì˜ í•´ê²°ë²• const sumPwrs = (a, p) => a.reduce( (s, n) => s + n ** p, 0); const arrayMadness1 = (a, b) => sumPwrs(a, 2) > sumPwrs(b, 3);
package kata func SquareSum(numbers []int) (result int) { for _, num := range numbers { result += num*num } return }
function squareSum(numbers){ return numbers.reduce((a,b)=>{return a+b*b}, 0) }
def square_sum1(numbers): result = 0 for n in numbers: result += n*n return result def square_sum2(numbers): return sum(x ** 2 for x in numbers)
function twiceAsOld(dadYearsOld, sonYearsOld) { return Math.abs(dadYearsOld - sonYearsOld*2) }
def twice_as_old(dad_years_old, son_years_old): return abs(dad_years_old-son_years_old*2)

TIL 6/22/21 ì¿ í‚¤ì˜ ìŠ¤ì½”í”„ 1. íƒ­ ê°„ì— ê³µìœ ë˜ëŠ”ê°€? 2. ìƒˆ ì°½ì„ ì—´ë©´ ìƒˆë¡œìš´ ì„¸ì…˜ì´ ë§ºì–´ì§€ëŠ”ê°€? 3. ì¿ í‚¤ëŠ” í¬íŠ¸ê°„ì— ê³µìœ ë˜ëŠ”ê°€? Cookies do not provide isolation by port. If a cookie is readable by a service running on one port, the cookie is also readable by a service running on another port of the same server. If a cookie is writable by a service on one port, the cookie is also writable by a service running on another port of the same server.

Since SessionStorage is tab specific, it is not accessible from web workers or service workers.
